entry.value-ref: Collection of physical elements that comprise a computer system.
A set of programs that manage computer hardware resources and provide common services for application software.
A control flow statement that allows code to be executed repeatedly based on a given boolean condition.
Refers to a control parameter used by a class of functions typically associated with some types of programming languages.
An organization that provides access to the Internet.
Used to describe a document signed by multiple parties in a circle to make it more difficult to determine the order in which it was signed, thus preventing a ringleader from being identified.
Principal communications protocol used for relaying datagrams (also known as network packets) across an internetwork using the Internet Protocol Suite.
